entries.title: What is nuclear fusion and why is it important?
entries.description: Scientists announced that they have successfully created a nuclear fusion reaction which researchers have been attempting to do for decades. NBC News’ Hallie Jackson breaks down how this new technology could replace the way energy is made and potentially move away from the current usage of fossil fuels.

entries.title: Ticketmaster Mexico to face millions in fines over Bad Bunny concert tickets screwup
entries.description: Ticketmaster Mexico may face millions in fines after hundreds of fans were denied entry to Bad Bunny's concert in Estadio Azteca following ticketing issues.

entries.title: Who will win in Ukraine? It may be whoever runs out of ammo last
entries.description: Artillery fire has defined the war in Ukraine and securing enough ammo for big guns on the battlefield could decide the outcome, U.S. officials and experts say.

entries.title: Pope Francis sympathized with migrant caravans seeking 'freedom and well-being'
entries.description: Pope Francis sympathized Monday with the caravans of Latin Americans “seeking freedom and well-being” in the U.S. as he celebrated Our Lady of Guadalupe.

entries.title: Ancient coins unearthed in desert cave could point to evidence of Maccabean revolt
entries.description: An ancient treasure trove of silver coins found in a desert cave in Israel could add new evidence to support the Hanukkah story of the Maccabean revolt.

entries.title: Watch: New Zealand's Ardern caught on hot mic making vulgarity
entries.description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was caught on a hot mic using a vulgarity against a rival politician. As an aside after she sat down Ardern said what sounded like, “He’s such an arrogant pr———.”

entries.title: Venezuela's Maduro will fully open border crossings with Colombia next year
entries.description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro on Monday announced his intention to fully open the border crossings with Colombia starting Jan. 1.

entries.title: Dozens of countries meet to pledge aid for Ukraine during winter months
entries.description: Dozens of countries and organizations, including G7 member nations, met in Paris to aid millions of dollars behind Ukraine in its conflict with Russia ahead of the winter months. NBC News' Ellison Barber reports on what specific needs Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy asked for during the conference.

entries.title: In Peru's rural areas, anger fuels protests agains the government
entries.description: Thousands of rural Peruvians who voted for the now-ousted president Pedro Castillo, also from a poor Andean region continued protesting the new government.

entries.title: 2 officers among 6 killed in Australian ambush, siege
entries.description: Six people, including two young police officers, were shot and killed at a property in rural Australia after officers who arrived to investigate reports of a missing person were ambushed, authorities said Tuesday.

entries.title: Donors meet in Paris to get Ukraine through winter and Russian bombing
entries.description: Dozens of countries and international organizations threw their support behind a fresh and urgent push Tuesday to help Ukraine survive Russian attacks at a conference in Paris on Tuesday.

entries.title: U.S.-Africa Leaders Summit kicks off under China's long shadow
entries.description: The Biden administration is pitching trade at the U.S.-Africa Leaders Summit, a bid to re-engage the continent's leaders as China outpaces U.S. investment.

entries.title: Supporters of Brazil’s defeated Bolsonaro attack police headquarters
entries.description: Supporters of far-right Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro on Monday attempted to invade the federal police headquarters in the capital Brasilia.

entries.title: Libyan in 1988 Lockerbie bombing will not face death penalty
entries.description: The Justice Department says it will not seek the death penalty for Abu Agila Mohammad Mas’ud, a former Libyan intelligence official accused of making the bomb that brought down Pan Am flight 103.

entries.title: Bolsonaro supporters torch vehicles, clash with police in Brasília
entries.description: Supporters of outgoing Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro clashed with police on Monday, setting fire to several vehicles in the capital Brasília.

entries.title: European Union reels as corruption scandal tarnishes parliament’s credibility
entries.description: The European Union’s parliament was reeling Tuesday as a corruption and bribery scandal damaged lawmakers’ careers and fingers pointed to Qatar.

entries.title: BTS star Jin begins military service at front-line boot camp
entries.description: K-pop star Jin from supergroup BTS began his 18 months of mandatory military service in South Korea on Tuesday at a boot camp in Yeoncheon, near North Korea.

entries.title: New Zealand PM Ardern caught name-calling rival on hot mic
entries.description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern was caught on a hot mic Tuesday using a vulgarity against a rival politician.

entries.title: Six dead after an ambush on police officers in rural Australia
entries.description: Six people, including two young police officers, were shot and killed at a property in Queensland state in rural Australia after officers were ambushed, authorities said Tuesday.

entries.title: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried arrested in the Bahamas
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder and former CEO of the cryptocurrency giant FTX, was arrested in the Bahamas after U.S. authorities filed criminal charges

entries.title: BTS star Jin starts national service in South Korea
entries.description: K-pop fans waited in the cold for a chance to glimpse BTS member Jin as he arrived to start his national service.

entries.title: Palestinian flags appear in abundance at Qatar's World Cup
entries.description: Although the Palestinian soccer team failed to qualify for the World Cup finals in Qatar, the Palestinian flag has appeared extensively in the Gulf state's streets and stadiums.

entries.title: Indian, Chinese troops clash at border in fresh face-off
entries.description: Soldiers from India and China clashed last week along their disputed border, India’s defense minister said Tuesday.

entries.title: 2023 Golden Globe nominees announced
entries.description: The Golden Globes are back after controversy shrouded last year’s award ceremony. NBC News’ Gadi Schwartz has more on the recently announced nominations and the future of the show.

entries.title: Suspected Lockerbie bomber makes first court appearance in U.S.
entries.description: After 34 years, the former Libyan intelligence officer accused or making the bomb that blew up Pan Am 103 made his first appearance in court on U.S. soil. NBC News’ Andrea Mitchell has more details on the case.
